name: Electric Vehicle
title: Electric Vehicle

api_list.name: /nonElectricVehicleTotal
api_list.description: The 'nonElectricVehicleTotal' endpoint in the 'Vehicle' API provides a user-friendly way to an array of strings that represents different values for the field named 'nonElectricVehicleTotal'. This field refers to the total number of non-electric vehicles. The array contains various numeric values, each indicating the count of non-electric vehicles. By making a request to this endpoint, you can retrieve all the possible values for 'nonElectricVehicleTotal'. The values could range from a few digits to larger numbers, reflecting the count of non-electric vehicles in a particular context or dataset. These values enable you to gain insights into the overall quantity of traditional vehicles within the specified information source. The endpoint ensures convenient access to this information, enabling users to analyze and interpret the scale of non-electric vehicles effectively.

api_list.name: /date
api_list.description: The 'date' endpoint from the 'ElectricVehicle' API returns an of strings that represent various dates related to electric vehicles. These dates are not specific to a particular event but can be used as reference points for different activities or milestones in the electric vehicle industry.By accessing this endpoint, you can obtain a range of important dates that have relevance to electric vehicles. These dates could include significant releases of new electric vehicle models, advancements in battery technology, or upcoming events and conferences focused on electric mobility.The returned array provides a variety of dates in a user-friendly format, making it easy to understand and utilize. It allows users to stay updated on crucial developments and milestones in the electric vehicle sector, aiding them in planning, research, or staying informed about industry trends.

api_list.name: /percentElectricVehicles
api_list.description: ThepercentElectricVehicles' endpoint provides an array of strings representing the possible values for the field 'percentElectricVehicles' in the ElectricVehicle API. This field indicates the proportion or percentage of electric vehicles among all vehicles in a given context. The returned array contains various values, each indicating a different percentage. These values help quantify the adoption and prevalence of electric vehicles in different locations or settings.By accessing this endpoint, users can gather valuable insights on the penetration and popularity of electric vehicles within a specific area or industry. The data enables researchers, policymakers, and businesses to assess the impact of electric vehicles in terms of sustainability, energy consumption, and environmental benefits. These values can assist in monitoring the progress and growth of electric vehicle adoption over time.The 'percentElectricVehicles' endpoint is useful for analyzing trends and making informed decisions regarding the development and promotion of electric vehicle infrastructure, charging stations, and policies. It grants users the ability to compare percentages across different regions and assess the effectiveness of measures taken to encourage electric vehicle usage.

api_list.name: /totalVehicles
api_list.description: The 'totalVehicles' endpoint in the ElectricVehicle API provides a-friendly way to retrieve a collection of strings representing the total number of vehicles. The endpoint allows you to query and obtain all the possible values for this field. By accessing this endpoint, you can get meaningful insights into the number of vehicles associated with electric transportation. The returned array of strings contains various values, each representing a count of vehicles. These values could be interpreted as the total number of electric cars, buses, or any other type of electric vehicles present in a given dataset or context.For instance, if you obtain a value of 2684, it signifies that there are 2684 electric vehicles in the dataset or system under consideration. Similarly, a value of 192 denotes 192 electric vehicles, and 68 represents 68 electric vehicles.This endpoint can be highly beneficial for electric vehicle fleet managers, researchers, or anyone interested in understanding the quantity of electric vehicles. It provides a convenient way to access and analyze the distribution or patterns of electric vehicles based on their count.

api_list.name: /plugInHybridElectricVehiclesPhevs
api_list.description: The 'plugInHybridElectricVehiclesPhevs' endpoint in the 'ElectricVehicle' API provides a collection of strings that represent the possible values for the field 'plugInHybridElectricVehiclesPhevs'. This field is associated with plug-in hybrid electric vehicles (PHEVs), which are automobiles that combine both an internal combustion engine and an electric motor. PHEVs are designed to be charged from an external power source and typically offer the flexibility of running on either electricity or gasoline.By accessing this endpoint, you can retrieve an array of strings that represent various values related to PHEVs. These strings may include information such as the PHEV model names, unique identifiers, or corresponding numerical codes associated with different types of PHEVs. This endpoint grants you the ability to explore and utilize these values within your applications or systems, enabling you to make informed decisions or perform specific actions based on PHEV-related data.

api_list.name: /dataListIndex
api_list.description: The 'dataListIndex' endpoint from the ElectricVehicle API provides a user-friendly way to retrieve all the possible values for the field called 'dataListIndex'. This endpoint returns an array of strings that represent unique identifiers or reference numbers associated with specific data entries related to electric vehicles.These dataListIndex values allow users to access and retrieve specific sets of data, such as battery statistics, charging history, vehicle diagnostics, or performance metrics. By using the dataListIndex endpoint, developers or users can dynamically retrieve an array of all available dataListIndex values, which can then be used in conjunction with other endpoints to access the corresponding data.For instance, if a user wants to analyze the charging history of a specific electric vehicle, they can first request all the available dataListIndex values using this endpoint. They can then use these dataListIndex values to retrieve the relevant charging data for each entry.In summary, the 'dataListIndex' endpoint is a convenient mechanism within the ElectricVehicle API that returns an array of strings representing all the possible values for the 'dataListIndex' field, enabling easy access to specific sets of electric vehicle-related data.

api_list.name: /electricVehicleEvTotal
api_list.description: The 'electricVehicleEvTotal' endpoint from the 'ElectricVehicle' API provides a list of possible values for the field 'electricVehicleEvTotal'. This field represents the total number of electric vehicles (EVs) associated with a particular query. The endpoint returns an array of strings, where each string represents a numeric value. These values can vary depending on the query parameters used.For instance, if you query the API to retrieve the electric vehicle count in a specific region or city, the endpoint will provide an array of strings representing the possible counts of EVs in that location. These string values could range from 1 to larger numbers, indicating the number of electric vehicles found in the queried area. By utilizing this endpoint, developers can obtain a comprehensive understanding of the electric vehicle landscape in different regions or locations. This information can be valuable for analysis, research, or planning purposes related to the growing presence of electric vehicles and their impact on transportation and sustainability.

api_list.name: /county
api_list.description: The 'county' endpoint from the ElectricVehicle API returns a list of counties. A county is an administrative division within a state, and this endpoint provides an array of strings representing the names of different counties. For example, the API may return counties like 'San Diego,' 'Fresno,' or 'Placer.'By accessing this endpoint, users can retrieve a comprehensive and up-to-date list of all the possible county values. This information can be useful for various purposes, such as filtering or categorizing electric vehicle (EV) data by county. For instance, a user could use the county endpoint to obtain a list of available counties and then use that information to retrieve EV data specific to a particular county, such as charging station locations, incentives, or statistics.Overall, the 'county' endpoint in the ElectricVehicle API enables users to explore and access data in a user-friendly manner by providing a collection of county names.

api_list.name: /vehiclePrimaryUse
api_list.description: The 'vehiclePrimaryUse' endpoint of the 'ElectricVehicle' API provides a user-friendly way to retrieve a list of possible primary uses for a vehicle. The endpoint returns an array of strings that represent the various primary uses that can be associated with a vehicle. These primary uses indicate the main purpose or function for which a vehicle is intended. For example, some common primary uses might include 'personal use,' 'commercial use,' 'rental,' or 'fleet.' By accessing this endpoint, developers can obtain a comprehensive list of all the available primary uses for vehicles. This information can be valuable for applications that need to categorize vehicles based on their primary purpose, such as booking platforms, fleet management systems, or electric vehicle charging networks.Overall, the 'vehiclePrimaryUse' endpoint simplifies the process of retrieving and managing primary use data for vehicles through a straightforward and easy-to-understand interface.

api_list.name: /state
api_list.description: The endpoint 'state' in the ElectricVehicle API provides a collection of strings representing the possible values for the 'state' field. This 'state' field refers to the location or region where the electric vehicle is registered or being used. The 'state' values returned by this endpoint help identify the specific geographical area associated with each electric vehicle. For instance, if an electric vehicle is registered in California, one of the possible values that may be included in the array from this endpoint would be 'CA'. Similarly, if another electric vehicle is registered in New York, one of the array values could be 'NY'. These values indicate the different states or regions within which the electric vehicles are operated.By querying this endpoint, developers can retrieve the complete list of available 'state' values, which can be helpful for various purposes. It enables users of the ElectricVehicle API to filter or sort electric vehicles based on their respective states or regions, facilitating more specific and targeted data analysis or retrieval.

api_list.name: /batteryElectricVehiclesBevs
api_list.description: The 'batteryElectricVehiclesBevs' endpoint from theElectricVehicle' API provides a convenient way to retrieve a of possible values for the 'ElectricVehiclesBevs field. This field represents the of battery electric vehicles (Vs) available for a given. When calling this endpoint, the API will return an of strings, each representing possible value for 'batteryElectricVehiclesBevs'.This is particularly useful for obtaining into the availability or quantity of BEVs in a specific context. By analyzing the returned array, users can gain a better understanding of the range and distribution of BEVs across different locations or time periods. It allows users to quickly access relevant information about the number of BEVs and further utilize it for research, analysis, or decision-making purposes.Note that the actual values in the array are not provided in this description, as they may vary depending on the specific query and data source used for the API.

api_list.name: /records
api_list.description: The 'records' endpoint in the ElectricVehicle API is the primary point of interaction for users. When utilizing this endpoint, you will receive a collection of objects that contain the relevant information based on your query parameters. These objects represent individual rows of data, allowing you to retrieve specific details tailored to your requirements.By accessing the 'records' endpoint, users can seamlessly obtain a comprehensive array of information related to electric vehicles. This endpoint acts as a gateway to access a wealth of data, empowering users to explore, analyze, and derive insights from the vast repository of electric vehicle records.Whether you're an electric vehicle enthusiast, a researcher, or a business professional, the 'records' endpoint offers a user-friendly solution to access real-time or historical information about electric vehicles. Discover details such as vehicle models, specifications, charging data, environmental impact, and more, all packaged in a concise and intuitive format through this API endpoint.The 'records' endpoint provides a seamless interface to access and navigate the world of electric vehicles, enabling users to make informed decisions, gain knowledge, and contribute positively to our sustainable future.
